intro: Dichapetalum discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats.
